behavior.task:
Execute the following in the notebook: 1. Import pandas as pd and os 2. Verify file exists at './assets/housing.csv' using os.path.exists() 3. Load the CSV file using pd.read_csv('./assets/housing.csv') into variable 'df_raw' 4. Print df_raw.shape to show dimensions 5. Print df_raw.dtypes to show column types 6. Print df_raw.head() to preview first 5 rows 7. Verify: df_raw is a DataFrame, has rows (shape[0] > 0), has multiple columns (len(columns) > 1)
Store the loaded DataFrame in variable 'df_raw' for use in subsequent steps.

outputs.artifact: pandas.DataFrame containing raw housing data with all original columns and rows
